contents: NextAI 2018 is a Toronto based accelerator for early or idea stage AI-enabled startups. Made it to the finalist round among thousands of applications around the globe. Unfortunately, we were not shortlisted for proceeding into the next round. However, the connections and resources gained from the diverse set of individuals coming from a variety of different fields is indispensable.
title: Next AI 2018 Finalist

contents:
Biophysicist & Computer Scientist Machine Learning, Data Mining, Computer Vision, Medical Diagnostics
Hi, my name is Omar Abid and I am a technology enthusiast with a strong interest in computer vision, machine learning, and electronics. I am a highly motivated individual and I believe that through collaboration, we as a human species can bring new innovations to make the world a better place.
How can we use technology to improve patient outcomes? To provide better medical diagnostics? To understand which patients are at risk of complications in the near future?
How can we use technology to better understand financial markets? To leverage the blockchain technology?
Technology excites me, but questions drive me. Check out the Experience and About Me sections to learn more about me. If you would like to connect with me, visit the Contact Me page for my email.
Part B Omar is currently a data scientist at Watopedia who obtained his H.BSc degree in Biophysics followed by a MSc in Computer Science with a specialization in Computer Vision. He has an extensive theoretical foundation in Mathematics, Physics and Neuroscience with hands on experience using a diverse set of machine learning techniques – DNN, SVM, Reinforcement Learning. Omar’s interdisciplinary background and experience provides the perfect mix of a deep understanding of A.I. with the practicality required to develop state of the art software.
title: Blog Post 1

title: Toronto Buskerfest Volunteer

contents: This summit is the annual gathering of mission-driven entrepreneurs, leaders, and professionals who want to do well by doing good. As a volunteer helping ticket holders find their way through the venue, I had the opportunity to connect with highly motivated individuals.
title: Archangel Summit 2017 Volunteer

contents:
I have also been part of the following startups.
Delivery From Mars. An on campus food deliver application that uses a peer-to-peer network to connect individuals wanting food and grabbing food. Includes a rewards program to incentivize users to recurrently use the application.
Fix My Tech Now. Provide software and hardware repairs for laptops, desktops, Xbox, Xbox 360 and PS3.
Bitcoin Arbitrage. Buy and sell bitcoins at a high profit margin. For efficiency and to reduce mundane tasks inherent in such a system, we created a software (available on GitHub) to stream line this process.
title: Startups

contents:
Teaching Assistant at York University EECS 1011 (September 2016 - December 2016) Computational thinking through Mechatronics. Invigilate and mark labs in addition to providing a tutorial at the beginning of each lab.
EECS 1570 (January 2016 - April 2016) Introduction to Computing for Psychology. Invigilate and mark labs in addition to providing a tutorial at the beginning of each lab.
EECS 3311 (January 2016 - August 2016) Software Design. Invigilate exams, tests and quizzes as well as aid in marking of assignments, projects and exams.
EECS 3301 (May 2016 - August 2016) Programming Language Fundamentals. Invigilate exams, tests and quizzes as well as aid in marking of assignments, projects and exams.
Tutor Experience PASS Leader (September 2011 - April 2013) Group study session organizer and facilitator: Prepare and facilitate study sessions for undergraduate students taking first and second year science courses: Chemistry, Math, Physics. Take part in hiring new employees.
Tutor Doctor (September 2013 - September 2015) Tutor high school and university students for a variety of subjects: Physics, Chemistry, Math, Computer Science.
title: Teaching Assistant and Tutoring

contents:
Research Assistant at York University Active and Attentive Vision Lab Supervisor: John K. Tsotsos Description“: Addition of new features to TarzaNN – a neural network simulator. Implemented in C++. Report can be found here.
Electrophysiology Lab (October 2013 - April 2014) Supervisor: Roger Lewis Description“: Design and development of an electronic circuit for current-voltage measurements of Neurospora crassa hyphae. Report can be found here. For more information about the project, click here.
Attention Learning Lab (April 2013 - August 2014) Supervisor: Thilo Womelsdorf Description“: Statistical EEG Data analysis of Macaque Monkeys for neural population decoding. Analyzed with Matlab’s Statistics and Machine Learning Toolbox. Scripts and documentation can be found here.
Attention Learning Lab (October 2013 - August 2014) Supervisor: Thilo Womelsdorf Description“: Collect and analyze data from human participants to assess the impact of different strategies for learning the relationship between stimulus and reward. Leveraged Matlab’s Statistics and Machine Learning Toolbox. Final publication may be found here.
title: Research Assistant

contents: A modification of a LSD SLAM repository to allow for PointCloud visualization with color. The full project can be found on GitHub.
title: LSD SLAM with color PointCloud visualizer

contents: This repository is an implementation to perform realtime tracking with Tensorflow using a SSD model trained on the COCO dataset. It is based on the Simple Online and Realtime Tracking with a Deep Association Metric Deep SORT algorithm. The full project can be found on GitHub.
title: TensorFlow Object Detection with Tracking

contents: This repository demonstrates how one can do Object Detection in real time using GPUs that are available on Google Cloud for free using Google’s 1 year credits. We use a You Only Look Once archictecture for object detection that can be visualized in a web browser as shown below. The full project can be found on GitHub.
title: Object Detection on Google Cloud Platform

contents: This repository provides a step by step guide for how to find layers in a neural network using TensorFlow and then visualize them as shown in the image below. The full project can be found on GitHub.
title: TensorFlow Layer Visualization

contents: Publication: R. Sengupta, O. Abid, A. Bachoo, J.K. Tsotsos 2017. Attentional blink as a product of attentional control signals: A computational investigation, VSS 2017. [Link]. Implemented in C++ with TarzaNN framework. A video demonstration shows the GUI of the system processing a stream of input letters.
title: Attentional Control Signals, Poster Publication

contents:
Instructor: Scott MacKenzie
Design and implementation of a hand tracking and hand gesture classification system used to demonstrate it’s capability as an adjunct to a computer mouse. Link. Used several technologies for its implementation in Matlab:
 Image Processing Algorithms: Color segmentation, Background subtraction, Histogram of Gradient (HOG) feature extraction
 Hand Tracking Algorithm: Kalman Filter
 Real time Gesture Classification using Matlab’s Neural Network Toolbox
title: Computer Vision based hand mouse cursor system

contents:
Distributed Computing Instructor: Eric Rupert
Description: Distributed computing is the study of how distributed networked computers pass messages, coordinate their actions. Such systems provide improved reliability and efficiency. Topics include GPU programming, synchronous and asynchronous systems, and computational complexity theory. Below you will find several assignments that were completed when taking this course.
 Two Generals Problem (Assignment, Solution) Asynchronous Processes (Assignment, Solution) Byzantine Failures (Assignment, Solution) K-set Consensus Problem (Assignment, Solution) Shared Memory System (Assignment, Solution)  Computer Vision Algorithm Comparison Instructor: Minas Setsakis Description: Test a variety of different feature extraction algorithms on real world images. See the report here.
title: Course Work

contents:
Supervisor: Roger Lew
Design, Fabrication and Testing of a New and Improved Voltage Clamp Instrument. The report can be found here.
A picture of the completed circuit.
The circuit we designed is shown below.
title: Voltage Clamp Instrument

contents:
This file exists solely to respond to /search URL with the related search layout template.
No content shown here is rendered, all content is based in the template layouts/page/search.html
Setting a very low sitemap priority will tell search engines this is not important content.
This implementation uses Fusejs, jquery and mark.js
Initial setup Search depends on additional output content type of JSON in config.toml
[outputs] home = ["HTML", "JSON"]  Searching additional fileds To search additional fields defined in front matter, you must add it in 2 places.
Edit layouts/_default/index.JSON This exposes the values in /index.json i.e. add category
... "contents":{{ .Content | plainify | jsonify }} {{ if .Params.tags }}, "tags":{{ .Params.tags | jsonify }}{{end}}, "categories" : {{ .Params.categories | jsonify }}, ...  Edit fuse.js options to Search static/js/search.js
keys: [ "title", "contents", "tags", "categories" ]
title: Search Results
